intro: Schizanthus grahamii var. coccinea, commonly known as the scarlet lily of the Incas, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with trailing stems and produces clusters of funnel-shaped blooms. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The botanical features of this variety make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its striking appearance and adaptability.
